longInfo:
Passport required.
- Passports and/or passport replacing documents must be valid
  on arrival. 

Visa required.

Compulsory Currency Exchange:
- Visitors traveling to Libya for touristic purposes must
  convert USD 1,000.-, or equivalent, in freely convertible
  cash or debit the amount from a valid credit card upon
  arrival.
 - Exempt are those visiting a resident, provided holding
   proof of sponsorship covering entire stay (e.g.
   accommodation, medical care expenses etc.). 
 - Exempt are those traveling as part of a paid tourist
   package if holding a valid visa.
Additional Information:
- Normal non-biometric passports issued to nationals of
  Armenia must contain an endorsement stating the validity of
  the passport for stays abroad.
- Visitors are required to hold proof of sufficient funds to
  cover their stay.
Warning:
- Visitors will be refused entry if holding travel documents
  containing a visa (valid or expired) for Israel or any
  evidence of entry in Israel
vaccination:
Vaccination against yellow fever required if arriving within 6
days after leaving or transiting countries with risk of yellow
fever transmission For details, click here.

Exempt from Yellow Fever vaccination:
- Children under 9 months of age. 
- Passengers transiting countries with risk of yellow fever
  transmission provided not leaving the transit areas.
Recommended:
- For nationals of Libya and returning alien residents health
  certificates must have text translation printed in the Arab
  language.
